revised_title: The Impact of Fumarate on Cellular Respiration
tldr: The authors conducted a series of experiments to study the effect of fumarate on tissue respiration. They found that fumarate increases the respiration of muscle tissue, while malonate inhibits it. The addition of fumarate to the tissue acted as a catalyst, preserving the normal respiration of the tissue. The study also showed that tissue extract had a greater impact on respiration than fumarate alone, and that the extract's effect was not due to added substrate.
